description.p: The circle of twilight is compromised of druids who wish to be a part of not only the world they live in, but also the ethereal world that remains a mystery to so many. The members of this circle focus on making amends between spirits and the world. To be alone among spirits is extremely dangerous and this is why the members of this circle participate in many rituals to discover their personal spirit guide.

A spirit guide can take many shapes, sometimes as ethereal animals, others as incorporeal wisps, or simply as balls of light. These creatures guide the druids on their journey among the spirits of the deceased, however, they are not the only spirits which walk beside the druid.

description.p: You gain circle spells at the druid levels listed.
At 2nd level you gain a spirit sworn to serve alongside you. The familiar you summon using the find familiar spell is your Spirit Guide.
Your Spirit Guide is more durable than a standard familiar. It has maximum hit points equal to three times your druid level and has proficiency in the same saving throws that you do.

Your spirit animal also has inherent boons and magical effects. Select 1 lesser and 1 greater boon from the list of Spirit Boons. When you finish a long rest you can swap one boon you have for a new one of the same type.

sheet.description: The familiar you summon using the find familiar spell is your Spirit Guide. Your Spirit Guide is more durable than a standard familiar. It has {{spirit guide:hp}} maximum hit points and has proficiency in the same saving throws that you do. When you finish a long rest you can swap one boon you have for a new one of the same type.

description.p: Also at 2nd level, you can sense the auras of the recently dead. As an action, you become aware if any creatures have died in a 30 foot area around you in the last 24 hours. You do not know how they died, but you do know what type of creature they were (such as humanoid, beast or monstrosity).
This feature can be used a number of times per long rest equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1).
Additionally, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks made to interact with spirits.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, beasts and fey that you conjure are more resilient than normal. Any beast or fey summoned or created by a spell that you cast gains the following benefits:

ul.li: The creature has temporary hit points equal to half your druid level.
The damage from its natural weapons is considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks and damage.

sheet.description: Any beast or fey summoned or created by a spell that you cast gains the following benefits: The creature has {{level:druid (alpha):half}} temporary hit points. The damage from its natural weapons is considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks and damage.

description.p: At 10th level, the spirits share their knowledge of ancient magics. You can cast all druid spells with the ritual tag as rituals without having them prepared. You can add any 2 ritual spells from any spell list to your spell list, they count as druid spells and you can only cast them as rituals.
Also, you can choose an additional lesser boon for your Spirit Guide when you finish a long rest.

description.p: At 14th level, the ferocity of beasts and fey that you conjure are increased. Any beast or fey summoned or created by a spell that you cast gains the following benefits:

ul.li: The creature can add your Wisdom modifier to its AC, saving throws, attack, and damage rolls.
The creatures movement speed is increase by 10 feet.

sheet.description: Any beast or fey summoned or created by a spell that you cast gains the following benefits: The creature can add {{wisdom:modifier}} to its AC, saving throws, attack, and damage rolls. The creatures movement speed is increase by 10 feet.

description.p: At 18th level, the spirits you summon can shift between the realms at will. Any beast or fey summoned or created by a spell that you cast gains the following benefits:

ul.li: During the creature's turn it is ethereal; opportunity attacks against it are made with disadvantage and it can move through the space of any creature, though it cannot stop in a creature's space.
When you are going to take damage, if the creature is within 5 feet of you, it can use its reaction to take the damage instead. If it reduced to 0, you take any leftover damage.

element.supports: Artificer, Druid, Ranger, Warlock, Wizard, Occultist, KTHArtificer

description.p: You create an invisible magical sensor that floats just above your head and shares your space. You can see through the sensor in all directions. For the duration, no melee attack roll can have advantage against you, and you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on sight.
